did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Jo and Eloise A. Ray papers, 1920-1972.
did.physdesc: Photographs, correspondence, artwork, records, and architectural plans.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes sketchbooks, drawings, photographs, correspondence, notebooks, resumes, estimates, and job plans of Jo Ray and Eloise Ray.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Jo Ray was a landscape architect who designed Bryant Park in New York City and laid out the 1939 New York World's Fair. He also landscaped private estates, schools in Connecticut, New York, and Massachusetts, and other private and public projects. He graduated from Cornell University in 1925. His wife, Eloise Ray was also a landscape architect.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes sketchbooks, drawings, photographs, correspondence, notebooks, resumes, estimates, and job plans of Jo Ray and Eloise Ray.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Jo and Eloise Ray. Papers, #3760. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
